description: CE delegator routes for Entra endpoints return EE-only error payload when enterprise edition is disabled.
EE delegator forwards Entra route methods to EE handlers when enterprise edition is enabled.
`entraActions` exports compile and are available from integrations actions barrel.
Integrations settings page renders Entra entry card in EE mode.
`EntraIntegrationSettings` dynamic import loads successfully and renders base shell.
`entra-integration-ui` disabled hides Entra settings surface.
`entra-integration-ui` enabled shows Entra settings surface.
Client details Entra sync action is hidden when `entra-integration-client-sync-action` is disabled.
CIPP connection option is hidden when `entra-integration-cipp` is disabled.
Field-sync and reconciliation queue UI sections are hidden when their flags are disabled.
Migration creates `entra_partner_connections` with expected required columns.
Unique active-connection constraint rejects second active connection for same tenant.
Migration creates `entra_managed_tenants` plus indexes used by discovery/mapping queries.
Migration creates `entra_client_tenant_mappings` and enforces unique active mapping per discovered tenant.
Migration creates `entra_sync_settings` with default cadence and toggle fields.
Migration creates `entra_sync_runs` and expected status/count fields.
Migration creates `entra_sync_run_tenants` with valid foreign keys to parent sync runs.
Migration creates `entra_contact_links` with unique (`tenant`,`entra_tenant_id`,`entra_object_id`) constraint.
Migration enforces one active Entra link per contact.
Migration creates `entra_contact_reconciliation_queue` and lookup indexes.
`clients` table contains `entra_tenant_id` and `entra_primary_domain` columns post-migration.
`contacts` table contains Entra identity and sync metadata columns post-migration.
Existing tenants receive one default `entra_sync_settings` row during backfill migration.
New Entra interfaces/types compile and align with migration schema.
Mapping validation blocks duplicate assignment of one discovered tenant to multiple clients.
Unmap action updates mapping state without deleting historical sync run data.
Remap action updates active mapping to target client and refreshes client linkage fields.
Disconnect flow does not remove existing sync run history rows.
Schema defaults keep Entra sync metadata columns nullable for backward-compatible contact rows.
Lookup indexes on discovered tenants and mappings are used by mapping preview queries.
Direct connect initiation rejects users lacking update permission.
Direct connect initiation returns OAuth URL with encoded nonce/state.
Entra OAuth callback rejects missing/invalid code-state requests.
Entra OAuth callback persists token references and marks connection active.
Direct token refresh updates stored access token and expiry fields.
CIPP connect action validates base URL format and rejects invalid values.
CIPP connect action stores API token via tenant secret provider (not plaintext DB field).
Direct validation action succeeds with valid credentials and reachable tenant list.
CIPP validation action succeeds with valid CIPP token and tenant endpoint response.
Disconnect action clears provider-specific secrets and marks status disconnected.
Switching direct->CIPP removes stale direct tokens and vice versa.
Credential resolver prefers tenant Microsoft credentials when both tenant id/secret are present.
Credential resolver falls back to env credentials when tenant pair is absent.
Credential resolver falls back to app secrets when tenant/env are absent.
Secret key constants map all required direct/CIPP secret names consistently.
Provider factory returns direct adapter when connection type is direct.
Provider factory returns CIPP adapter when connection type is cipp.
Direct adapter tenant responses normalize into canonical managed-tenant DTO fields.
Direct adapter user responses normalize into canonical sync-user DTO fields.
CIPP adapter tenant responses normalize into canonical managed-tenant DTO fields.
CIPP adapter user responses normalize into canonical sync-user DTO fields.
Discovery action inserts new managed tenants and updates existing rows idempotently.
Discovery action updates changed display name/domain for previously discovered tenant rows.
Discovery action persists provider user counts per managed tenant.
Exact domain match appears in `autoMatched` preview group.
Secondary-domain match path contributes candidate confidence values.
Fuzzy match candidates are sorted by score and never auto-confirmed.
Preview returns unmatched list when no candidate crosses threshold.
Mapping table UI supports selecting candidate client for fuzzy/unmatched entries.
Skip control marks tenant mapping row as skipped without creating active mapping.
Bulk accept marks all exact auto matches as selected pending confirm.
Confirm mappings persists only selected mappings and does not write during preview stage.
Confirm mappings updates mapped client rows with Entra tenant id and primary domain.
Remap operation preserves one active mapping row and updates previous mapping state.
Mapping summary counters reflect mapped/skipped/review counts after confirm.
`Run Initial Sync` CTA remains disabled when there are zero confirmed mappings.
Skipped tenants panel lists skipped entries and allows remap entry.
Mapping wizard remains inaccessible while `entra-integration-ui` flag is off.
Entra Temporal types compile and are consumed by workflows/activities without `any` leakage.
`entraDiscoveryWorkflow` executes discovery activities in expected order.
`entraInitialSyncWorkflow` loads mapped tenants then processes each tenant sync.
`entraTenantSyncWorkflow` only syncs requested tenant mapping context.
`entraAllTenantsSyncWorkflow` processes all active mapped tenants.
`upsertSyncRunActivity` creates parent sync run with initiating user and mode.
`recordSyncTenantResultActivity` writes per-tenant result rows and counters.
`finalizeSyncRunActivity` marks run terminal state and summary totals.
Workflow registration index exports all new Entra workflows.
Activity registration index exports all new Entra activities.
EE workflow client can start initial sync and returns workflow/run IDs.
EE workflow client can start all-tenant sync and returns workflow/run IDs.
EE workflow client can start single-client sync and returns workflow/run IDs.
Progress query endpoint returns run-level and tenant-level status data for polling.
Mapping confirm action can optionally start initial sync workflow and persist run id.
Manual `Sync All Tenants Now` action starts expected workflow type.
Manual client-level sync action starts expected single-tenant workflow type.
Schedule setup creates Entra recurring sync schedule when not present.
Schedule setup updates existing Entra schedule definition when already present.
Workflow IDs are deterministic/deduplicated for repeated manual trigger collisions.
Workflow run with no mapped tenants completes gracefully with zero-processed summary.
Adapter failure in tenant sync marks tenant result failed and parent run failed/partial as designed.
Sync filter excludes disabled Entra users (`accountEnabled=false`).
Sync filter excludes users missing valid UPN/email identity.
Default service-account patterns are excluded from sync candidate set.
Tenant custom exclusion patterns are applied on top of default filters.
Exact email match links to existing contact and does not create duplicate contact.
No email match creates a new contact under the mapped client.
Multiple plausible matches generate reconciliation queue item instead of auto-link.
Name-only similarity without email never auto-links a contact.
Linking/new-contact paths persist Entra object id/source metadata fields.
Field sync toggle OFF prevents display-name overwrite on existing contacts.
Field sync toggle ON allows display-name overwrite for linked contacts.
Field sync toggle ON allows UPN overwrite for linked contacts.
Disabled upstream user marks linked contact inactive with sync reason.
Deleted upstream user marks linked contact inactive with sync reason.
Disabled/deleted handling never deletes contact rows.
Every processed contact gets `last_entra_sync_at` refreshed.
Contact link records refresh `last_seen_at` and status per sync.
Per-tenant counters include created count accurately.
Per-tenant counters include linked count accurately.
Per-tenant counters include ambiguous count accurately.
Dry-run sync mode performs no DB writes while returning preview counters.
Sync result serializer output remains stable across success/failure run states.
Retry of same tenant sync does not duplicate `entra_contact_links` rows.
Retry of same tenant sync does not duplicate contact creation for same Entra identity.
Reconciliation queue item stores tenant/client context and candidate detail payload.
Resolve queue -> existing contact links identity and marks queue item resolved.
Resolve queue -> new contact creates contact/link and marks queue item resolved.
Queue resolve rejects cross-client or cross-tenant contact targets.
Single-client sync only processes identities belonging to that mapped client tenant.
All-tenant sync skips entries currently marked as skipped mappings.
Settings status panel shows connection type/status, last discovery, mapping counts, and interval.
Sync history panel renders latest run list sorted by started time.
Sync history drilldown displays per-tenant outcome rows and counts.
`Sync All Tenants Now` button disabled when no active mapping exists.
`Sync All Tenants Now` button enabled once at least one active mapping exists.
Client-level sync action is shown for mapped clients and hidden for unmapped clients.
Client-level sync action returns run id and begins status polling successfully.
Ambiguous queue panel hidden when `entra-integration-ambiguous-queue` is disabled.
Ambiguous queue panel visible when `entra-integration-ambiguous-queue` is enabled.
Client portal user cannot access Entra settings actions/routes (403/forbidden response).
Client portal user cannot trigger manual sync endpoints/actions.
Internal user without `system_settings.read` cannot read Entra status/mapping views.
Internal user without `system_settings.update` cannot connect, map, or start sync.
Internal user with required permissions can complete connect -> discover -> map -> sync flow.
EE docs include both direct and CIPP setup paths and decision guidance.
EE docs include Entra secret names and note secret-provider/vault compatibility.
EE docs describe additive sync and non-overwrite behavior with field-sync toggles.
EE docs describe feature-flag rollout order for pilot tenants.
Disabling `entra-integration-ui` hides settings UI without deleting connection/mapping data.
Disabling `entra-integration-client-sync-action` hides client action while preserving server-side run history.
